content:
We just deployed chat.zulip.org, with a bunch of new featuers:

  • Slightly redesigned compose box (still need to change
  • Drafts management
  • Viewing your uploading files and muted topics under /#settings
The new compose box seems to have some sort of lag problem (hitting enter slows things down), I'll open an issue.
#3817
Feedback on all of these changes is much appreciated!
One thing that's still a TODO for compose is renaming "New stream message" to "New topic". @Cynthia Lin we might want to do that before updating any compose screenshots...
The new compose box is pretty nice! Though when I click on new message, the animation of the messages being pushed up is a bit choppy.

Also is there any changes in the alert word tab in settings? The style is a bit strange
pasted image
Clicking on Drafts opens up the compose box for a new message, I don't think that's necessary
Probably is some click-handler acting weird.
Oh yeah, that might be a bug.
Also umm, in the dropdown, when you click on settings, it goes to #settings and then #settings/your-account
It would be nice if it would directly link to #settings/your-account so that you don't have to click the Back button twice to get back to where you were before.
Loading the settings popup is a bit slow for me...
Even the subscriptions popup is slow too right? @Tommy Ip
Yep there is like a ~0.3 second delay
For me it's like 1.5 s
probably ~0.6s for settings...
And opening the compose-box has also become very laggy.
It definitely seems slower/less responsive than what it was before.
My ipad loads both of the popups faster than my laptop...
Weirdly the popups are pretty fast on localhost.
Is the JS for those async loaded?
Well, I don't think it is making any AJAX request when opening those popups.
Oh and the settings page not working on 90% zoom isn't fixed yet. I think Brock knows how to fix this.
BTW is there any reason why we aren't using http/2? I think nginx fully supports it.

Oh and the settings page not working on 90% zoom isn't fixed yet. I think Brock knows how to fix this.

How come it doesn't work at exactly 90% zoom?
Well 90% zoom and lower ofcourse :P
Hmm that alert words thing is definitely broken; one of you investigating?

Also maybe the drafts button should be grayed out if there are no drafts?
The blue Drafts link in compose now shows up for me regardless of whether I have drafts.
I agree.

Also, when you click the Drafts button, it opens the compose box.

When you click the blue drafts button in compose and close the drafts window, it closes the compose box also.
We should probably start opening issues for these little bugs :)
I'll look into the compose box/drafts bug.
Another bug I discovered was that, if you type a message in the chat, open the "formatting" modal and close it. The compose box closes and the message disappears.
Hmm, it's possible we want to use a custom "compose-closed" event rather than the focusout event.
Well we already have a piece of code that doesn't close compose box if we're exiting a modal.
https://github.com/zulip/zulip/blob/master/static/js/click_handlers.js#L594
But the problem is, our new "overlays" don't have the ".modal" class.
Adding another condition to ignore overlays like drafts/informational overlays will fix it.

Btw the patch for fixing the compose box opening on clicking drafts button is

diff --git i/templates/zerver/compose.html w/templates/zerver/compose.html
index 8c8339e..19037d4 100644
--- i/templates/zerver/compose.html
+++ w/templates/zerver/compose.html
@@ -6,7 +6,7 @@
           <div id="compose_buttons">
             <span class="new_message_button">
               <a class="drafts-link no-style" href="#drafts">
-                <button type="button" class="button white small rounded compose_stream_button">
+                <button type="button" class="button white small rounded compose_drafts_button">
                   <span>{{ _('Drafts') }}</span>
                 </button>
               </a>
Sorry, couldn't make a pull request now.
OK I'll merge that
I feel the animation for adding and deleting lines in the compose box (when the message is more 2 lines) is a bit too slow for me.
I think that's actually a bug/lag, not an animation.
For drafts, maybe clicking anywhere on the draft should open it for edit? (Rather than having to click the edit button?)
Yeah, that's probably a nice improvement, similar to our reply semantics, though I suppose it could be annoying if there is interesting markup (e.g. an image) in there
Does clicking an image in the drafts view open the lightbox?

It doesn't show the image. E.g. (the following is a screenshot of the drafts modal, for a draft where I pasted a picture)
pasted image
ok, so I think it's fine but clicking a link should still open a link.
Open an issue?
(we need an 'ack' reply that's different from , I think)
Yeah, I kinda agree that it'd be nice to have an emoji reaction that is "working on it"
Not sure that works
haha
Opened as #3828, but without much detail (have to run, so won't have a chance to do it tonight). Feel free (anyone) to add to it!
Another issue is that links are treated as relative links in the drafts modal. So [link](moo.com) will go to chat.zulip.org/moo.com when you click on it in the modal.
I feel like we should remove the Blue Drafts button.
The one present with the compose box open?
Yeah.
With the new drafts button i feel like the blue one is kind of redundant.
You may be right. I think it's worth paying some attention to whether one ends up using the blue button
It's possible that folks often have the compose box open when they want drafts
I guess even if we keep it, we probably want to mute it a bit; the blue kinda stands out
I guess I only use it when the compose box is open and I need to check my drafts for something I wrote before. Or remember midway through writing that I have something written in my drafts.
I seem to have managed to have 10 drafts that are half-finished compositions to clean up just now.
(deleted)

@Rishi Gupta About the links thing, our front-end markdown parser treats links differently than what our backend-parser does. To fix that, we will need to change the frontend link renderer to treat all URLs as absolute here:
https://github.com/zulip/zulip/blob/master/static/js/echo.js#L458

But I'm not sure if that is a good idea, we could also directly render from the backend every time we display drafts but that would be too slow.
Thoughts on this @Tim Abbott ^
I think fixing the relative vs. absolute links issue is probably a good idea
We generally don't render things with links at all on the frontend
But this seems like an application where that makes sense
OK I think we just deployed a fix for the compose perf issues; please let us know if you see them after reloading!

Can I make a little suggestion?
Could there be a version number somewhere in Zulip?
Right now this server is somewhere between 1.5.1 and 1.6, right? Since things get update so often here it would be nice to have that represented in a number or a date and time stamp.
@Matthias Müller that's a good idea. Where do you think it should be displayed? You can get it from page_params.zulip_version in the JS console, and the value is 1.5.1+git
But obviously it'd be nice to have it somewhere in the UI

Sorry, no idea what to do with page-params.zulip_version
It does meet to front and centre; maybe on the settings page somewhere.
Most software puts it in the start up screen or menu item 'about'
I guess one easy answer is we could put it in https://chat.zulip.org/about/ (and update and link to that page)
Yes, that's good!
two more ideas but not strinctly design related

1. timed messages that are deleted from the UI and the database after 1/5/10mins:
companies without a good login management might be sending password around. Those could be removed again. It would also allow for OTR conversations. Since not everyone might want such a feature admins could deactivated in admin settings
deletion wouldn't have to remove rows from the database but rather overwrite the fields with 'expired' or something like that

2. private group conversations that are not streams:
use case > I'm working in a company but want to do a non-work related group order online with 5 more people. Would be silly having to create a stream for that. Generally there would be enough private chatter as well that doesn't fit into streams, nor is it useful to have a stream for any combination of people. Skype does that quite well.
how it would work: holding Ctrl and clicking names in the contact list. Hit enter and it opens the msg box. sending the msg would actually create it.
I guess this would require more under the hood changes
if this isn't the place for feature idea/request where would be?
actually I think a new feature stream is missing so that individual requests can be their own topics

@Matthias Müller For your second idea, you already have the ability to start a private conversation with multiple people, but it might not be super obvious. https://chat.zulip.org/help/send-a-group-of-people-a-private-message

We have had various ideas about making the "group PM" experience better, such as allowing topics for private messages or having some way to kind of a upgrade a small group conversation into a public stream. Another idea is to allow topics on streams to be muted by default to people unless they are specifically mentioned or they send a message.
oh wow... brilliant. that's was the one things that really annoyed some people in the company but it's actually there... that means Zulip will certainly take over things here ;-)
but then it would still be nice to rename group PMs especially if they have the same kind of people in 1st and 2nd position and only the third, forth are different
@Matthias Müller how do you think about the difference between being able to rename a "Group PM" thread vs. creating a new private stream?

strange, can't reply anymore by just clicking the last msg in stream>topic. have to click chevron of that message and remove the quote
anyway
I see your point @Tim Abbott. The whole point of Zulip is structured conversation. But in a company there is a lot of communication going on that has only temporary relevance and there is just as much stuff that needs to be kept (in a stream). Other option would be to be able to convert a private group chat msg into a stream msg to transfer it. A conversation that started private and trivial leads into ideas relevant for others. Rather than copying the content into the stream, it can be moved to the stream (ie. option under chevron). But it's not a high priority thing...

I personally prefer the quote and reply button to be an option (like press enter to send) instead of being the default. Zulip fits the reply workflow instead of quoting since we have small targeted streams of conversation.
Though I guess we don't want too many options since it is hard to maintain/update/test

Sorry, I'm not actually sure what you prefer. I like clicking the msg in the stream and the msg box pops up with the right top. I switched to Firefox just now and it works again. Chrome is misbehaving.

Sorry that was a bit confusing. It used to be that there is a reply button in the drop down chevron which does not quote the message. I got used to that so I don't reply to a message by clicking on the message box...

Ah, I see... I only mentioned quote and reply because Chrome played up. Here a gif: I was clicking on the msg but it didn't get selected, nur did the msg box open up. I closed Chrome completely and reopened it - works again.
Chrome bug
If sometimes clicking doesn't open compose to reply, that must be a very recent regression (I've never heard anyone complain of that)
Hmm that's interesting, can you try to reproduce it?
I tried a bit myself and can't reproduce. What platforms + browser version?

I can't either now: Chrome Version 56.0.2924.87 (64-bit), Win 10 1604
I mostly sleep my PC and leave the browser open. Maybe that's way. Don't worry too much - it's probably a rare thing. Was first time today.

One potentially confounding factor, though, which we might want to work around, is that I switched my mouse recently to a different one, and it has problems sometimes with clicking (in general) is treated a drag, not a click.
Anyway, if you do see this again, would love a reproduction recipe :)

sure: now back to topic ;-)
wouldn't it be useful to move the entire Chrome bug conversation to a different stream (ie. 'bugs' if it existed)... The nature of conversations is that they change and flow. If a group realises that mid-convo then could move to a different stream or from private group msg to stream msg.

ah - ok. Realised a challenge. I can only change topic for my own msgs of course. Someone would need to be 'in charge' if multiple person's msgs were to be moved all the sudden... it becomes quite a group effort. Nevermind. you have more important stuff on the roadmap
Org admins can change topics for other folks' messages
I find that once folks get more used to Zulip, they get better about changing the topic when they start talking about a new thing (e.g. some bug)
